page.title: 06STAPLOW - NEW DEVELOPMENTS
page.content: a){The Blacksmith's Forge}unused for many years, now produces artistic metal work. This is mainly for individual commissions for customers from all over the country. b){Many small farms}in the area have become part of a Company with a manager in each main unit. c){A 600 yard section of the Hereford {and Gloucester Canal,}unused for 100 years, has been dug out and filled by electric pump with water from the nearby River Leadon, assistance having been given by the local Water Authority. Three ponds have been stocked with trout for{fly-fishing and three with{coarse fish.}Regular clients pay daily to fish and later on local clubs will hire the coarse fish ponds for fishing matches. When the new bungalow is built on site, a trout hatchery will be developed.
